data.title: Not consistent :(
data.text: I ate here for the first time in July and loved it. My husband and I were excited about going back to Cazuela's on our next trip into Rio Rancho. I ordered the exact same thing and was very disappointed (carne adovada), my husband also said his was better the first time there. Not sure if we will back. :(

data.title: Great food and beer in an out of the way place
data.text: Went to Cazuela's because we found it on "Places Near Me".  Not easy to find and a bit small.  Had an extensive beer on tap list (about 20) and several were quite good.  The food was very tastety and not expensive.  The only negative was that the service was rather lackadaisical - - and it was not becasue they were busy.  A bit more attention from the wait staff would have made it a much better experience.

data.title: Kid Friendly patio
data.text:
We have 3 young children and look for restaurants where they don't have to just sit still and be quiet the whole time. Cazuelas has a great patio for them to run around and climb on old go carts, and even access the old batting cages. (They've been abandoned every time we've gone). So they love it. Anywhere that I can sit down and enjoy a meal/beer without fighting with my kids to be still or be quiet is great for me! 
The food is good. Nothing amazing, but not bad either. The service has been good most of our visits. Again, nothing incredible, but they get the job done. 
It's a bit pricey. ($7.99 for a child's plate!) But we usually have an enjoyable experience. Tonight my food was especially good! 
I recommend it for anyone that enjoys New Mexican food...and to anyone with squirmy kiddos! 
Overall, we enjoy coming here.

data.title: Combining Seafood with Mexican is Delicious!
data.text:
We thoroughly enjoyed the outdoor terrace with it's peaceful fountain while dining at Cazuela's.   (It was very pleasant temperature wise in the late evening though the day had been 100F). By sitting outside we also learned that there is a batting cage available as well.  If you prefer air conditioning they had a nice indoor seating area as well.
I highly suggest the molcajetes--absolutely delicious combining the chicken and shrimp (come separately in a dish and then you put the mixture in a tortilla like you would when ordering fajitas).

data.title: Finally - a Saturday Happy hour!
data.text: Surprised with $1 discount on their draft beers after 2:00 p.m. on a Saturday.  Enjoyed the shrimp and chips appetizer as well.

data.title: Food was average, but the beer was excellent!
data.text: We were searching out local breweries and decided to try this one for dinner. The beer was excellent, they also provided a lot of information on the bar board about how it was made. We also ordered dinner here, had green chile stew and shrimp ceviche. The meat in the stew was kind of fatty, not the best. The ceviche was really good, and the refried beans were good. The rice was average. We did enjoy our visit, the staff was very nice and we had good service. We LOVED the beer.

data.title: Decent Mexico food.
data.text:
The food is average, but decent Mexican food. We mostly only
 eat breakfast here, its not bad, my wife likes the hand held breakfast burrito, and I like the breakfast plate. The staff is ok, but don't complain about anything served incorrectly, it will be your fault. I would rate this restaurant a notch higher, but the cockroaches that greeted us just outside the front door persuaded me not to. In all fairness, a lot of restaurnts have cockroaches, it's the nature of the beast, I just don't like to see them.

data.title: Poor Service
data.text:
We like the food but the frustration is not worth it. We keep giving them another chance, but it just doesn't improve.
I seldom write a poor review, but save yourself the stress & keep driving.

data.title: Great food, so so atmosphere
data.text: Cool little local place now trying to be a brewpub as well.  Stick to providing great New Mexican food!  Service is okay but not always stellar.  Love the chilequiles for breakfast!

data.title: Best Mexian food in Rio Rancho
data.text: If you want real Mexican food not New Mexican this is the place to go- Carne Asada is fantastic and lots of different dishes to choose from- We love the chips and Salsa-

data.title: Taco Tuesday is the best!
data.text: They have awesome beer and prices. Their Tacos are really great. The chicken are my favorite. Great chips and salsa!

data.title: Beer-Yea!  Fried shrimp-Nay!
data.text: Stopped in at 3 p.m. on a Saturday.  Wet IPA was terrific, but the shrimp & fried appetizer I ordered was way over-fried.  I was so overdone that I couldn't eat it all.  I'm guessing they don't have a regular cook outside of the usual meal hours.  I'll be back, but I certainly won't order any food at 3 in the afternoon!

data.title: Everything's variable.
data.text: Set up as a brew pub with nice mountain vistas, it's this way and that way, every visit.  They specialize in Mexican-style seafood.  The fish is OK good.  The homebrewed root beer is sometimes great, sometimes a bit ghastly often out.  Waitstaff has a just-on-probation glaze to their eyes, not much jump to them.  It can be pretty good.  It could be good.

data.title: Late afternoon Friday lunch
data.text:
My late afternoon lunch with my son and wife did live up to the hype. We had dined here a couple years ago and things have really changed. We sat in the tap room and other than the AC blowing to hard, the space is a nice area with a view of the Sandias. Patio seating is an option but not when it is drizzling and you have a toddler. 
The chips and salsa starter is some of the best salsa in Rio Rancho. I ordered the combination plate #2, my wife ordered a stuffed sopapilla and son had a bean cheese burrito. All were more than filling servings. 2 of 4 needed take put boxes. 
I had their award winning stout, the name is escaping me at the moment, but it is one of the best craft stouts in New Mexico. 
We will definitely be back for dinner. Make this a destination for those of you in ABQ that dread making the trek across.
They offer .50 cent wings during their Happy Hour from 2-6. We did not try the pizza they offer either. The perridillas looked and smelled great, looking forward to trying those on a future visit.

data.title: bad experience
data.text: Bad food, gloomy atmosphere, pricey, and though our server did try to be attentive, it seemed like the kitchen staff just ignored anything he was writing down on the order slip.  A truly awful experience.  Will definitely not be returning to this place.

data.title: Awful food!
data.text: We went for late lunch on a Saturday.  The place was almost empty, gloomy, and the food was of very poor quality, despite being pricey.  Our waiter did give good service and apologized several times for the different mistakes on our order....none of which were his fault.  He had written the order correctly, as well as additional notes.  The kitchen staff, however, did not follow his order.  The food was terrible, and this was one of the worst meals I've had in a long while.  I remember this place when it was just a little hole in the wall place across the street.  The food was delicious always, and very reasonably priced.  Now it is more expensive and nasty!  I will not be back.

data.title: Excellent food!
data.text: Excellent food and wonderful service!  We highly recommend trying this place.  The margaritas were great and very cold!

data.title: warm beer, mediocrity at best
data.text:
After giving this place a second chance, we won't be returning again. 
Service: The servers have absolutely no idea of the components of the menu. We had to get up to get our own water from styrofoam cups located near the bar. After asking repeatedly for salsa, we finally got some right as we were getting ready to leave. 
Food: The nachos were TERRIBLE! A poor version of chili con queso, topped with scant lettuce and tomato garnish. They were out of jalapenos, and wanted to charge extra for sour cream and guac! 
Drinks: The beer, although brewed in house, was served warm. Although the coconut margaritas were good, they were out of ingredients to make another round.   
There are better choices for mexican, seafood, good beer and delicious coconut margaritas in town.

data.title: Tasty Mexican food and great beer!
data.text: Whenever we are in the mood for good Mexican food, and great beer, this is the place. Favorites include their carne adovada and seafood dishes. Their micro-brewed beer is some of the best in town, especially their Panama Red-Red Ale. Great prices too!

data.title: Poor Service Poor Food
data.text: Hate to bash so bad, however this place could be so nice.  Find the right people to run your restaurant and it will be amazing!! Use fresh ingredients please!!!
